com.amazon.device.ads

Interface AdListener


  • public interface AdListener
    Tracks life-cycle events of an ad. Use this class to determine when to take action based on the current state of an ad. Register this class with an ad view by calling AdLayout.setListener(AdListener).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAdCollapsed(AdLayout view)
      Called after a user clicks on the close button on an expanded rich media ad.
      void onAdExpanded(AdLayout view)
      Called after a user clicks on a rich media ad and after the rich media ad expands.
      void onAdFailedToLoad(AdLayout view, AdError error)
      Called whenever the retrieval of an ad fails.
      void onAdLoaded(AdLayout view, AdProperties adProperties)
      Called each time an ad is successfully loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • onAdLoaded

        void onAdLoaded(AdLayout view,
              AdProperties adProperties)
        Called each time an ad is successfully loaded. Use this to log metrics on ad impressions.
        Parameters:
        view - The instance of the AdLayout that the ad loaded in.
        adProperties - Detailed properties about the ad that loaded.

      • onAdExpanded

        void onAdExpanded(AdLayout view)
        Called after a user clicks on a rich media ad and after the rich media ad expands. Use this event to optimize user experience when leaving the current activity.
        Parameters:
        view - The instance of the AdLayout that the ad expanded is in.

      • onAdCollapsed

        void onAdCollapsed(AdLayout view)
        Called after a user clicks on the close button on an expanded rich media ad. This method is called immediately after collapsing the ad. Use this event to optimize user experience when resuming your applications activity.
        Parameters:
        view - The instance of the AdLayout that the rich media ad is in.

      • onAdFailedToLoad

        void onAdFailedToLoad(AdLayout view,
                    AdError error)
        Called whenever the retrieval of an ad fails. An ad can fail for a number of reasons, which can be grouped into two categories: transient and non-transient errors. When an error is transient, you should make another call to load the ad based on a standard re-try algorithm, or when conditions change, e.g. network available. When the failure is non-transient, you should log the error and investigate why your app is unable to successfully retrieve an ad.
        Parameters:
        view - The instance of the AdLayout that the ad that failed to load is in.
        error - The details of the error that occurred.
